alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 7:40PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 740 PM MST...An area of heavy snow was affecting portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties. Periods of heavy snowfall will persist through 830 PM MST. HAZARD...Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour, strong winds in excess of 45 mph, and visibilities less than one quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous, life threatening travel conditions. Locations impacted include... Tie City Campground, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Vedauwoo, Tie Siding, Granite Springs Campground, Pumpkin Vine, The Buttes, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford and Yellow Pine Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 318 and 340. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!
